newsitem.title: GREECE: Albanian soldiers request asylum in Greece.
newsitem.headline: Albanian soldiers request asylum in Greece.

text.p: Seven Albanian soldiers requested political asylum in Greece on Thursday, the first to do so since Albanian rebels and the army clashed near the Greek border this week, a Greek defence ministry spokesman said.
The soldiers would be considered political refugees until the foreign and public order ministries decided whether to grant them asylum, spokesman Dimitris Katsoulis said.
Katsoulis had no details on the circumstances under which the soldiers turned themselves over. He said all of them had been on active duty inside Albania.
They were the first Albanian soldiers known to have asked for asylum in Greece since rebels clashed with the Albanian army just across the Greek border.
An Albanian military plane landed in Italy on Tuesday and two pilots asked for asylum.
Albania has been in chaos since the collapse of fraudulent saving schemes in January which devastated many families.
Troops have been enforcing emergency rule since Sunday to try to put down violence in southern Albania, including a number of towns and villages near the Greek border.
